poem:
**Unseen Numbers**

In the silence, they count—
figures forgotten,
hidden,
the pulse of the infinite.

Not Newton, not Nash,
shadows of minds uncelebrated,
yet the same stars
twinkle
in their summing dreams.

History's columns
shift. The secret equations
are written
in every hue, every hand—
on the unseen parchment of time.
